sentences.sContent: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.sCn: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

sentences.sContent: ...a newly-developed off-price concept which might help it better compete with ambitious T...
...Companies are more likely to succeed in the long run if they compete on quality or performance than on price...
...She speculated that professors might try even harder to make classes interesting if they were to compete with the devices...
...colleges have to compete in the marketplace...

remMethod.val: com(共同) ＋ pet(追求， 寻求) ＋ e → 共同追求一个目标 → 竞争

words.tran: 竞争的；比赛的；求胜心切的

trans.tranCn: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
trans.tranOther: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country
